intro:
Performance Management Basics

What is Performance Management?

Performance Management is:

  • A strategic approach to improving performance in employees.
  • A system within a company that links organizational objectives to employee performance.
  • It includes performance review plans, employee performance measurement, coaching, recognizing, and rewarding the performance of employees.
summary:

intro:
Performance Management Approaches

What are the Different Approaches to Performance Management?

Traditional Performance Management

  • Focus on review process not people.
  • Formal and event driven.
  • Separate from work.
  • 3-5% impact on performance.

Everyday Performance Management

  • Focus on people not process.
  • Formal and event driven.
  • Separate from work.
  • 3-5% impact on performance.

Everyday Performance Management

  • Focus on people not process.
  • Informal and ongoing.
  • Integrated with work.
  • Up to 39% impact on performance.
summary: Choose a Performance Management Approach that works for your organization.

intro:
Performance Management Systems

What is a Performance Management System?

  • The goal of a Performance Management Plan is to improve employee performance.
summary:
A Performance Management System outlines how performance management will becarried out in an organization.

A Performance Management System is key to the success of an organization.

A successful Performance Management System:

  • Has a clear purpose.
  • Is linked to the mission, vision, and strategic direction.
  • Fits within the organizational culture.
  • Has clearly defined roles, processes, and timelines.

intro:
Performance Management Process

What is a Performance Management Process?

The Performance Management Process is:

  • Collaborative, communication-based process
  • Executed in alignment with the Process Management System
  • Made up of 4 steps.

What are the Steps in a Performance Management Process?

The Performance Management Cycle.

  1. Performance Planning
  2. Performance Coaching
  3. Performance Review
  4. Recognition/Rewarding
summary:
• The Performance Management Process is a collaborative process.
  • The Performance Management Process is a four-step process involving planning, coaching, reviewing, and recognizing.
  • The Performance Management Process is cyclical.

What is a Performance Appraisal?

A Performance Appraisal is periodic assessment of an employee’s performance based on the agreed assessment measures.

A Performance Review is the meeting that happens between an employee and their manager to discuss the employee’s performance

intro:
Performance Appraisal Forms

What is Included in a Performance Appraisal Form?

Regardless of the type of Performance Appraisal you utilize, a Performance Appraisal Form will have all or some of the following criteria.

  • Employee information including evaluation period.
  • Core Competencies
  • Performance Goals
  • Rating System
  • Employee Feedback
  • Career Aspirations
  • Sign off summary
summary:
Performance Appraisal Forms support the Performance Appraisal Process

  • Core Competencies are measurable skills, knowledge, abilities, and behaviours required to competently fulfill the responsibilities of a role.
  • Connecting the employee’s performance goals to the strategic goals of the organization will create meaning for the work that they do which boosts employee engagement.
  • A properly designed performance rating system will differentiate high performance from low performance; identify areas of improvement, highlight development opportunities; and provide transparency in decision making.

intro:
Performance Interview

How to set the stage for a Performance Interiew

As a Manager it is important to understand that the performance interview can be the most rewarding or most debilitating process for an employee.

It is up to you to ensure positive outcomes regardless of how bad employee performance has been and to recognize that improvement is possible.
summary: You have now learned how to successfully conduct a performance interview which is step 3 of the performance management process – the performance appraisal. Having a positive performance appraisal experience will improve an employee’s feelings of satisfaction with their job, which will motivate them to work harder and since improving employee performance is the overarching goal of performance management plans, it is critical for a manager to learn how to effectively conduct a performance interview. The more employees are engaged and satisfied with their work, the better the organization as a whole will perform.
